snippet: Doubts about the identity of an Eritrean suspect taken into custody were raised within hours of the announcement that an arrest had been made.
abstract: Doubts emerge over whether man arrested in Sudan and extradited to Italy is notorious Eritrean human trafficker Medhanie Yehdego Mered; several people claim that man is Medhanie Tesfamariam Berhe, not smuggler who has been linked to boat accident that killed 359 migrants; connections within Eritrean government, which has been accused of profiting from trafficking, may have helped Mered avoid detention.

byline.original: By CHRISTINA ANDERSON, JEFFREY GETTLEMAN and ELISABETTA POVOLEDO
byline.contributor: Christina Anderson reported from Gothenburg, Sweden; Jeffrey Gettleman from Nairobi, Kenya; and Elisabetta Povoledo from Rome.

lead_paragraph: Doubts about the identity of an Eritrean suspect taken into custody were raised within hours of the announcement that an arrest had been made.

headline.main: Questions About Suspect’s Identity Circle Human Trafficking Case
headline.print_headline: Questions About Eritrean Suspect’s Identity Circle a Human Trafficking Case

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
